intro: Amsinckia micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leafed morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Bindweed family (Convolvulaceae) and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy, typically blue or purple flowers that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Amsinckia micrantha is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
